paper_metadata.title: Evaluation of Family Hope Program (PKH) on Poverty Alleviation in Aceh Province, Indonesia

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: a national initiative launched in 2007 to support impoverished families through conditional cash transfers aimed at improving access to education and healthcare

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: approximately 85% of families reported that the financial assistance aimed explicitly at education helped them keep their children in school | A health survey conducted prior to and after PKH's implementation indicated a 40% increase in the utilization of healthcare services among enrolled families
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This study adopted a mixed-methods approach, specifically a sequential explanatory design that integrates both qualitative and quantitative research methods

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: A mixedmethods approach, combining quantitative data analysis and qualitative interviews, was employed to measure the welfare-improving effects of PKH and validate the survey results

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The Family Hope Program (PKH) is one of the national anti-poverty initiatives implemented by the Indonesian government
evidence_citations.country_citation: This study presents an evaluation conducted in Indonesia to assess the impact of the Family Hope Program (PKH) on poverty alleviation
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: Communities that are eligible and entitled to receive PKH assistance are those that have met the following requirements: 1) Pregnant women 2) Having young children (toddlers) 3) Having children who are still in school 4) Requiring additional working capital
